item.title: ðŸ†• Check the dashboard
item.description: The dashboard’s debug page will indicate you basic debug info like if one of Reachy’s motor or force sensor is disconnected or if you forgot to turn on Reachy’s motors before booting its computer. You can also check the status of reachy_sdk_server.service in the dashboard’s services page to get error messages. Access the dashboard From the robot: Access the dashboard at 127.0.0.1:3972 From any other device on the same network as the robot:

item.title: Quick Debug
item.description: Problem with Python SDK If you’re using the Python SDK you may encounter the following error when trying to connect to Reachy. Debugging the SDK server Verify the service status If you are using one of the system.d service only: ðŸ’¡ Note: By default, reachy_sdk_server.service should be running. Open a terminal on the computer, and enter: sudo systemctl status <name_of_the_service>.service The service should indicate â¬¤ active (running) as shown below.

item.title: FAQ
item.description: Non exhaustive list of common questions from Reachy’s users. If you don’t see yours in it, don’t hesitate to drop a message on our support channel on Discord! > How to find the IP of my robot? Check the Find my IP section. > Got '_InactiveRpcError' when I try to use ReachySDK from Python SDK. It’s very likely that you have a problem with reachy_sdk_server, the server running Reachy’s software.

item.title: Support
item.description: Discord Join our discord if you have any questions or simply want to join the discussion! ðŸ‘‰ Any questions relative to your development with Reachy?Go to Pollen Community on Discord Pollen Robotics support For any specific questions concerning your robot or if you meet problems with the product, please contact us at support@pollen-robotics.com.
